intro: Marcgravia cuspidata, commonly known as the arrowleaf stinging vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped, velvety leaves. The plant produces striking white or pink flowers that are often accompanied by bracts. Its stems are covered in fine, stinging hairs that can cause irritation upon contact. Marcgravia cuspidata is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests.
